channel.title: The BEST Server Base?
channel.description: What do you think is the [b]BEST[/b] server base to use including decent framework, content, and bug-free? Post what you think and why you think that

item.title: The BEST Server Base?
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

Just saw Epicrus shutdown. Sad to see.

I am one of like 4 people with the Arrav source code. I was hosting a server off of it for a very short time, but then the original developer and creator (Rene) was like wtf and called me irl and truly asked me nicely not to use. I shut down and haven’t used it since, but if I was looking to create a server i’d probably rip bits out of there.
-Also, the marcbob from 1-2 years ago would’ve released or sold Arrav, but I’m not like that anymore.

tl;dr version: I have Arrav so I would use that

Also, people may hate on soulsplit, but it has some great features and stability making it the best server base (if only people had it :P)

Read full topic

item.title: The BEST Server Base?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Christmas_tree, post:50, topic:480359”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=598594.msg4219241#msg4219241 date=1360630415]
Actually the ability to hold 2k players just reflects on the stability of the server, if a server can only hold 200-500 max it’s likely to lag and crash more often simply because of consistency
[/quote]

But let’s ignore the fact that blitz only sends a couple of packets and that it is more likely to crash your sever than real players?[/quote]
Look back at my sentence, I didn’t say a single fucking thing about blitz

item.title: The BEST Server Base?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

sinisoul:

Apollo has some pitfalls in design that makes it complicated

This. I would have used it if it didn’t come to Ruby. And some other stuff I forgot. >.>

eyeownyew:

The packaging of Apollo is terrible. Some people argue that the packaging is so complicated because Graham was trying to help others hoping to create new packages have a better layout, but I see no point for Graham doing that as the user can just do that themselves if they find it necessary. Really no reason for there to be > half as many package identifiers as there are classes

It isn’t at all, it SORTA reminds me of Hyperion’s, which in my opinion is very simple.

Read full topic

item.title: The BEST Server Base?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

The packaging of Apollo is terrible. Some people argue that the packaging is so complicated because Graham was trying to help others hoping to create new packages have a better layout, but I see no point for Graham doing that as the user can just do that themselves if they find it necessary. Really no reason for there to be > half as many package identifiers as there are classes

Read full topic

item.title: The BEST Server Base?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:38, topic:480359”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=598594.msg4218300#msg4218300 date=1360544799]

They aren’t cluttered with useless packaging (Apollo)

Useless packaging?

overly complicated, im guessing

not at all.

it’s an opinion…

obviously. which is why I stated mine.

ok, explain why you like it/why it’s good, or whatever.
[/quote]

Apollo is set up in a more efficient way than most servers. It makes better use of the available processing power and really separates codec from the game logic. Aside of that, it comes with more features than say, Hyperion. Also I like the Ruby plugin environment, specifically the fact that it’s meant to be an easy way for contributors to write plugins which people can then add to their source by simply downloading it and adding it in the plugins directory. Why do you think the design is complicated?

edit: I’m coming from a standpoint of Apollo > public releases, yes it is very complicated and has some incomplete features. Another reason why I like Apollo vs something else is because really I can write new features in Apollo probably ten times quicker than I write the equivalent features within say a wL simply because of the proper use of objects, classes, etc.[/quote]

packaging

Read full topic

item.title: The BEST Server Base?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:37, topic:480359”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=598594.msg4218297#msg4218297 date=1360544578]

They aren’t cluttered with useless packaging (Apollo)

Useless packaging?

overly complicated, im guessing

not at all.

it’s an opinion…

obviously. which is why I stated mine.
[/quote]

ok, explain why you like it/why it’s good, or whatever.[/quote]

Apollo is set up in a more efficient way than most servers. It makes better use of the available processing power and really separates codec from the game logic. Aside of that, it comes with more features than say, Hyperion. Also I like the Ruby plugin environment, specifically the fact that it’s meant to be an easy way for contributors to write plugins which people can then add to their source by simply downloading it and adding it in the plugins directory. Why do you think the design is complicated?

edit: I’m coming from a standpoint of Apollo > public releases, yes it is very complicated and has some incomplete features. Another reason why I like Apollo vs something else is because really I can write new features in Apollo probably ten times quicker than I write the equivalent features within say a wL simply because of the proper use of objects, classes, etc.

Read full topic
